reasoning: Includes hydatidiform mole and choriocarcinoma. Global incidence ~1-2 per 1000 pregnancies, translating to ~2.5 per 100k person-years. Higher in Asia (up to 12 per 1000 pregnancies), lower in North America/Europe (0.6-1.1 per 1000).
source: Lurain JR (2010). Gestational trophoblastic disease I: epidemiology, pathology, clinical presentation and diagnosis. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 203(6):531-539
